changelog.entry: Removed MERCENARY_WORK_START event from Engi sector

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_MCCLONEY
event.text: An intruder teleports on deck. You cannot believe your eyes: it's Doctor McCloney, a famous human researcher and inventor of a clonebay! "Spare me from your most honorable reception. This ship has to change course immediately, I am late for scientific conference in an Engi world nearby."

choice.text: Give a lift to Doctor McCloney.

event.text: "Of course you will make sure that I attend the meeting as soon as possible. But did you know that I am not Doctor McCloney himself, just one of his countless clones? I am the only person in the Federation who is legally allowed to have clones."

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_MCCLONEY_QUEST
event.text: Doctor McCloney leaves the cabin reserved for VIP, safe from fire hazards and equipped with autonomous oxygen generator. "A bit late, but I won't blame you for the delay." The researcher leaves the ship, and you have time to explore what Engi have to offer.

There are all kinds of medical equipment in the Engi system. The Engi doctors are operating on all kinds of patients: saving burnt Mantis and dried Slugs, transplanting organs and removing tumors with their superior knowledge and technology.

There are all kinds of medical equipment in the Engi system. The Engi doctors are operating on all kinds of patients: saving burnt Mantis and dried Slugs, transplanting organs and removing tumors with their superior knowledge and technology.

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_MCCLONEY_QUEST_MEDBAY
event.text: One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Crew immortality. Mission success probability increase: 0.174%."

The medbay is uninstalled, and Engi laborers bring a cloning system as a replacement. The crew transfers their DNA data. They are not looking forward to getting cloned, but do not question your orders.

"Med-Bot Dispersal. Area of effect wound treatment. Mission success probability increase: 0.002%."

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_MCCLONEY_QUEST_CLONEBAY
event.text: One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Medical facilities. System interchange."

The Engi from the station help you with installation. They clear the DNA data and remove your cloning system and install a new medbay in its place. Leaving the system, you make sure not to cross paths with Doctor McCloney again.

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_MCCLONEY_QUEST_NONE
event.text: One of the Engi doctors learns that you are one of the last remnants of Federation force and offers to help you. "Medical facilities. Clonebay recommended."
For a small amount of scrap, the Engi workers agree to install a medical system on your ship. The doctors from the hospital provide medications and observe the installation process.

The Engi doctors and laborers flood your ship, bringing materials, and installing a cloning system in one of empty rooms. The crew transfers their DNA data. They are not looking forward to getting cloned, but do not question your orders.
An unorthodox choice. The crew installs a med-bot delivery system in one of your weapon slots and loads it up with ammunition.
The Engi doctor brings one of their latest inventions. He tries to explain you how it works, but you struggle to understand anything but a few words: "Nano-bots" and "Micro-cloning."

changelog.entry: Added Engi Transport tracked by pirate quest event

event.name: WOONA_ENGI_TRACKED_BY_PIRATE
event.text: Arriving to the next beacon, you encounter a pirate ship. The captain contacts you. "Don't shoot buddy. I see that you have got a powerful ship and I have a proposition."

"I tracked an Engi ship that transports all kinds of valuables: fuel, weapons, drones, you name it. Instead of destroying each other and gaining nothing, we could profit. Whoever gets to the Engi first, gets the loot."
You are here to save the Federation, not to profit by destroying allied ships. You decline pirate's proposal and charge your weapons.
"Good thinking, mate. I am sure that we will both benefit from this." You charge the FTL drive, aiming to reach the given coordinates as soon as possible.

destroyed.text: It seems that the pirate did not have much. After destroying the ship, you scrap the remains.

deadCrew.text: It seems that the pirate did not have much. After killing enemy crew, you collect scarce resources.

event.text: You arrived to the location specified by the friendly pirate. It seems that you were fast enough to outrun the pirate. The Engi ship filled with useful gear is waiting.
Your mission to save the Federation is difficult, and you need all possible equipment you can get. If piracy is the only way, then you are willing to sacrifice your honor.

choice.text: Inform the Engi about the pirate that is following them.

event.text: "Too late. Subject already destroyed." The Engi charge the FTL drive and leave the system.

You arrived to the location specified by the friendly pirate to find an Engi ship already destroyed and the pirate in the process of salvaging the equipment. "Whoever gets to the Engi first, gets the loot. Remember, friend?"
You are not leaving empty-handed! You prepare for the battle hoping that at least some gear will survive the fight.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

destroyed.text: The pirate explodes, leaving behind a substantial collection of useful scrap material.

event.text: After dealing with the pirates, you finish salvaging the remains of the Engi ship, finding some useful resources.

deadCrew.text: The pirates are all dead, leaving the ship dead in space.

event.text: After dealing with the pirates, you finish salvaging the remains of the Engi ship, finding some useful resources.
You search the ship and discover that its cargo was new military-grade weaponry! It was somehow undamaged in the fight and can easily be mounted on the ship.
You search the remains of the ship, but only come across blueprints and debris from broken machinery. A shame, but you take what scrap you can salvage.
The ship was transporting weaponry. You find a piece still intact, despite the battle.
The ship was apparently transporting weaponry; however, nothing seems to have survived the battle.
Searching the remains, you find that the cargo was military-grade Drone Schematics! You bring them aboard to install in your ship.
The debris implies that the ship was carrying Drone Schematics, but unfortunately nothing remains. You do find functioning Drone Parts, however.
The ship was carrying military supplies. You pick up anything that looks salvageable from the debris.
With the crew dead, you search the ship. You find military-grade weaponry and take what looks most useful.
